cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west into the Gulf of Mexico, then forecast to turn northwest and finally north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, crossing Georgia and moving offshore of the Southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast Big Bend through Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low (13%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Thu into Fri; gusty conditions possible if the track shifts east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge (likely <3 ft) possible if the storm exits into the Atlantic near Savannah.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands could drop 4 inches or more Thursdayâ€“Friday, creating localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential river/flash flooding and temporary port access restrictions due to heavy rain and gusty squalls.
